seas Oe REMAL PASHA Scores
Dated this the 4" day of January, 2016
ORDER

Petitioners are the accused in SC No. 651/2014 of the
District and Sessions Court, Kasaragod, which has arisen
from Crime No.564/2013 of the Adhur Police Station, for the
offences punishable under Sections 341, 323 and 506(i) read
with Section 34 IPC.

2. The matter has been amicably settled between the
petitioners and the defacto complainant, who is the 2™
respondent herein. The defacto complainant has _ filed
Annexure-A2 affidavit affirming that the matter has been
amicably settled between him and the petitioners, and he has
no complaints against the petitioners.

3. No criminal antecedents have been reported
against the petitioners. When the matter has been amicably
settled, no purpose would be served in proceeding with the

2016/KER/65
matter further, and therefore, Annexure- A711 final report and all
further proceedings against the petitioners in SC No.
651/2014 of the District and Sessions Court, Kasaragod,
which has arisen from Crime No.564/2013 of the Adhur
Police Station, can be quashed.

In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure- A1
final report and all further proceedings against the petitioners
in SC No. 651/2014 of the District and Sessions Court,
Kasaragod, which has arisen from Crime No.564/2013 of the
Adhur Police Station, are hereby quashed.

Sd/- B.KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE.
Stu/04.01.2016.
[True copy] P.S. to Judge
